newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexicans, foreigners to invest $15-16 bln in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Mexicans, foreigners to invest $15-16 bln in 1997.

text.p: Total private investment in Mexico this year from domestic and foreign firms will be in the range of $15 billion to $16 billion, the president of the Business Coordinating Council (CCE) said Tuesday.
Hector Larios Santillan told reporters after an event at the presidential residence of Los Pinos in Mexico City that the private sector would also create about 800,000 jobs this year.

Total private investment "will be in the region of $15 billion to $16 billion," Larios told reporters after a ceremony in which domestic business leaders from 31 major companies pledged to invest $7 billion in 1997.
More than 100 foreign businessmen are due to announce their investment plans for 1997 Wednesday, also at Los Pinos.
Larios said the private sector was confident of surpassing the 600,000 jobs he said it had created in 1996.
"All together, we estimate that about 800,000 jobs will be created in 1997," he said.
